A brilliant return to the Portal universe, retaining all of the elements that made the first game so fun and throwing in some new puzzle features to add difficulty and spice things up.  The story is just as darkly humorous and excitingly cryptic as the first installment, with a few more personalities to interact with.  The co-op puzzles are just a little more icing on the CAKE IS A LIE.

Portal 2 takes the concepts from one and expands upon them tremendously. The original was more of an extended demo, which could be completed in a single sitting. The second one, while still short, is much more dense with content. The story and world are more fully realized, the puzzles perfectly build off of one another, and the humor comes back in full force. The new mechanics feel like a necessary evolution, and they all work rather well. In truth, my only complaints regarding this game are the engine and the eleventh hour pacing. The engine is starting to show its age in that loading screens are entirely too frequent, and it really breaks up the gameplay. As for the so-called pacing at the eleventh hour, I'm not referring to story. The story pacing stays on point throughout. However, the last few puzzles introduce 2 new mechanics that I feel got rushed in and out of the game. You only use them in a handful of puzzles before being whisked away to the finale. Furthermore, I don't feel as if there was any puzzle that took every mechanic I had learned so far and sythesized it into the perfect puzzle to test myself in. Oh well. The game is still VERY fun, and I think it's an experience that everyone needs to have.

Эта игра,как розовый банан.Она настолько необычная,в серой массе посредственных FPS (да и Indie) игр.Эта игра вызывает такие ощущения,которые испытываешь при просмотре  фантастического фильма-утопию.Правда, это игра,и её еще нужно пройти (не самая простая игра я вам скажу,иногда ДАЖЕ(!) приходится включать мозг,ненавидеть игру и что называется "потеть",но оно того стоит).
     Мне,в принципе, понравилась первая часть,но вот от второй просто голова идёт кругом, настолько всё хорошо сделано и проработано (это,конечно,не "КРУЗИС" ,но игра выглядит не плохо).Дизайнеры уровней постарались на славу,уровни выглядят шикарно.Хотя вы спросите:"Да там же одни белые комнаты!"-и вы будите правы,но повторюсь,как же  всё здорово сделано.Это касается не только уровней,но и русской озвучки,которая дейсвительно порадовала.В самой игре музыки не так много и она по большей степени фоновая,но чего стоят кат-сцены в конце игры!
По моему скромному мнению, это одна из самых лучших игр,в кототрые я играл.Она точно запомнится вам на долго.
     Вообщем,извините,дорогие читатели данной статьи (если найдутся такие),за некоторые помарки и прочую ерудну,я,к сожалению не писатель, и побольше качественных игр на просторы, уж точно не галлактики,но,покрайней мере,земли=)Don't war,make love!Alloha!

Definitely a great game. But unfortunately, it suffers from the dreaded “sequel curse” and doesn’t manage to surpass its predecessor in every manner.

The puzzles, while still satisfyingly clever at times, have abandoned most of the mechanical skill required by the player to master.  So forget hard timed jumps or puzzles requiring coordination and reflexes, those have all been culled for the sake of what I can only assume to be accessibility and appeal to a greater demographic.  This is of course not necessarily a bad thing in a Portal 2—or any other entertainment product for that matter—as it manages to still retain some essential qualities, albeit maybe not emphasized in the same way as its predecessor. 

The design decision of mostly permitting to place portals where necessary to solve the puzzles stifles the creativity of the player, which could otherwise have been far more interesting and thought provoking.  Not to mention how much the game would gain from not having single solutions to every puzzle but dare to give free reins to the players and treat them as the intelligent people let loose in an interactive virtual world free from constrains and full of opportunities instead of herding them through something like an amusement park.

Overall, it was a fun experience and no doubt a great game, which is exactly why I think it deserves criticism; if for no other reason how much potential this time of game has.  To be honest, many of the things that the game sets out to do succeeded and the polish is impeccable.  A personal wish of mine would be that game developers were to put some more trust in gamers and their acumen, because certainly both games and gamers would have a lot to gain from a bit more of depth and just a little less handholding.  This does of course necessitate a good grasp of conveyance, something that Valve have excelled at (except with dota really) in the past—perhaps at times even in excess.

A smooth learning curve is undoubtedly a great thing but too much of a good thing can turn something that could have been a great puzzle into just an obvious obstacle. It is after all nice to have to think occasionally. Because in all honesty, 	 [i]why[/i] would we otherwise play [/i]puzzle games[/i]?

Portal 2 è un puzzle game sviluppato dalla Valve dove controlleremo una donna di nome Chell, prigioniera della Aperture Science Lab, un laboratorio dove vengono effettuati test sugli umani.
Dopo un breve tutorial iniziale nel quale recupereremo anche la nostra pistola spara potali, inizieremo ad effettuare test nelle varie camere del laboratorio ( ogni camera conterrà un enigma da risolvere  ).
Grazie ad un avvenimento improvviso riusciremo a scappare da una di queste camere di test e qui comincierà la nostra avventura.

Pro:
- Grafica buona e curata nei particolari
- Ottima caratterizzazione dei personaggi
- Dialoghi sarcastici, comici e tristi allo stesso tempo
- Enigmi divertenti da risolvere
- Presenza della coop online e LAN con tanto di campagna

Contro:
- Storia dei personaggi principali spesso "nascosta"
- Boss facili
- Occasionali lag durante la coop online
Very recommend
